oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter, from Clarence S. Robinson to Elizabeth (Betty) Black
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Clarence S. Robinson, Battery F, 308th Field Art., in Villaines (France), to Elizabeth (Betty) Black in Chattanooga, Tenn. He writes about the two prettiest girls in town that he has supper with every night. He also writes that they are ten and eleven "far too young to parleyvous love too." Born in Acworth, Tennessee, Robinson joined the Army in Chattanooga. He served overseas from October 28 to May 14, 1918.
